html.p: What: Perform calculations on events while retaining all original events and fields
Why: eventstats creates summary stats of fields without changing total number of events in the results.
So What: Calculated fields while keeping original granularity of data
We're using data we built earlier by using outputlookup. To build this see outputlookup
While yours may differ slightly, that data for us is:

search.query: | inputlookup rdf_cars.csv | eventstats avg(cars) as avg_cars_per_hour | eval avg_cars_per_hour = round(avg_cars_per_hour, 2)
| inputlookup rdf_cars.csv | eventstats avg(cars) as avg_cars_this_salesperson_per_hour by salesperson | eval avg_cars_this_salesperson_per_hour = round(avg_cars_this_salesperson_per_hour, 2)

panel.title: Creating a percent of total field

search.query: | inputlookup rdf_cars.csv | eventstats sum(cars) as "total_cars" | eval percent_of_total = round((cars / total_cars) * 100, 2) . "%"

| inputlookup rdf_cars.csv | eventstats sum(cars) as "total_cars_for_this_salesperson" by salesperson | eval percent_of_this_salespersons_total = round((cars / total_cars_for_this_salesperson) * 100, 2) . "%"
